summary.para: Represents a node of text content in xml.

remarks.para: XML has no concept of typed content; all content is textual in nature. In some cases this is inefficient, requiring translation between text and natural form (e.g. the characters '1','2','8' and the numerical value 128) or requiring more bytes of storage for the representation (e.g. the characters '2',5','5' might take 3 bytes, while the numerical value 255 could only take 1). This structure provides a way to indicate textual content in xml without physically representing it as the characters that comprise that value.
